made 3 edits between February 13, 2020 and February 13, 2020.

div.p:
Hunter Field Ga.
Tuesday
Dear Kids

Received box of candy + also
letters with pictures. Thanks a lot.
Candy was good and the pictures were
awfully cute. I got the letters just as
I started to town Saturday. I was
going after shoes that had been
repaired. I stuck the letter in the
folder where I have the shoe repair
list + when I got back to the
base I didn't have it. I throwed
a fit + in just a few minutes the fellow
in the shoe shop called up + said they
had it. Send me two of one kind
next time as I can send Louise one.
I sure would like to see them + have
a romp with them. Jerry looks as if
he is just about as much as Jimmy
could handle.

You asked wha I wanted for Xmas.
There isn't very much I need or
haven't got. I have plenty of everything to eat.
You would never know we were in
war by the way we are fed. Plenty of
milk, butter. In fact every thing.
About all a person could send me is
underwear + cosmetics. Stationery +
handkerchiefs. I do wear civilian
underwear. Don't send anything to
eat for we have so much more
of everything than you do.
How is G.W? Does he like it out
there? I had a letter from Peggy +
Mildred + they are not going to K.C.
Mildred sure was glad. She didn't
want to go.

I have had my breakfast. Eggs,
hot biscuits, breakfast food, apples,
jelly, butter, milk + coffee. So better
get dressed + report. Write often
Love - Mother -

S. Sgt. Ann Smith
A60 - A.700 - 158
762nd WAC Post Hg.6.
Hunter Field, Ga.
